title.value: Effects of incoming particle energy and cluster size on the G-value of hydrated electrons
title.justification: The exact title of the paper is given at the beginning under the authors' names.
title.quote: Effects of incoming particle energy and cluster size on the G-value of hydrated electrons

extractions.description: This paper investigates the time-evolution of the G-values for reactive species generated during water radiolysis using GEANT4-DNA, examining the effects of cluster size and linear energy transfer on G(e-aq).

type.justification: The study involves experiments and simulations using GEANT4-DNA to observe the effects on G-values, which indicates an empirical approach.
type.quote: The aim of this study was to investigate the time-evolution of the G-values for the main generated reactive species during water radiolysis using GEANT4-DNA.

name.justification: The research involves dosimetry and radiation interactions which are central to medical physics.
name.quote: a Medical Physics Unit, Department of Oncology, Faculty of Medicine, McGill University, Montréal, Quebec, Canada

name.justification: The paper discusses hydrated electron dosimetry and radiation dose measurements.
name.quote: In hydrated electron (e−aq ) dosimetry, absorbed radiation dose to water is measured by monitoring the concentration of radiation-induced e−aq .

name.justification: The paper is centered around water radiolysis and the formation of species from radiolysis.
name.quote: Water radiolysis is the decomposition of water molecules by ionizing radiation into different generated species, as listed in reaction R1.

name.justification: GEANT4-DNA is mentioned as the tool used for simulations in the study.
name.quote: The aim of this study was to investigate the time-evolution of the G-values for the main generated reactive species during water radiolysis using GEANT4-DNA.

is_contributed.justification: GEANT4-DNA is a well-known toolkit not explicitly introduced as a new contribution by the authors in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: GEANT4-DNA... was used to investigate the time-evolution of the G-values.

is_executed.justification: GEANT4-DNA was actively used in the simulations for the study.
is_executed.quote: The aim of this study was to investigate the time-evolution of the G-values... using GEANT4-DNA.

is_compared.justification: There is no indication that GEANT4-DNA was compared with other models in the paper.
is_compared.quote: GEANT4-DNA... was used to... study the validity of GEANT4-DNA for calculation of G(e− aq ) for clinically relevant energies.

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific referenced paper title provided for GEANT4-DNA within the provided content.
